alert.note: Alert for Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 23 at 10:07PM CDT until July 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Major, Woods and Woodward Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka. * WHEN...From Monday morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull conditions exist along the river... and some overflows may occur over some low-lying areas near the river. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
